meanings.definition: A person who informs on others, especially to the authorities.
meanings.sent1: The squealers told the teacher about the missing pencils.
meanings.sent2: The police caught the squealers who revealed the secret hideout.
meanings.sent3: The squealers in the movie always get caught in the end.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a squealer when she accidentally revealed the surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The neighborhood watch program relies on squealers to keep everyone safe.

meanings.definition: A device that emits a high-pitched sound, typically used as a warning or alarm.
meanings.sent1: The squealers on the fire alarm alerted everyone to evacuate the building.
meanings.sent2: The squealers on the car alarm scared away the thief.
meanings.sent3: The squealers on the doorbell were so loud, they made the dog bark.
meanings.sent4: The squealers on the whistle pierced through the noisy crowd.
meanings.sent5: The squealers on the security system kept the house safe from intruders.

meanings.sent1: The farmer took care of the squealers on the farm.
meanings.sent2: The children loved playing with the squealers in the barn.
meanings.sent3: The squealers in the mud looked adorable as they played.
meanings.sent4: The squealers in the pen were always hungry for food.
meanings.sent5: The squealers followed their mother around the pen, learning to oink.
